metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11719 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When importing a curve25519 private key in PKCS#8format with leading 0x00bytes, it is possible to trigger an out-of-bounds read in the NetworkSecurity Services (NSS) library. This could lead to information disclosure.This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.8, Firefox < 68, andThunderbird < 60.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11719` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.6
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.6
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.6
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '68.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.8.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
nss package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.6').
